Author: Alright#0419
Content: is there some way of preventing a chain split even if notaries do collude?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @polycryptoblog there is no provision that prevents any to any within a cluster, but the GUI could limit all destinations to a single chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unless it is critical it can only go to a single chain

Author: Alright#0419
Content: a split notary network, however unlikely, could be a problem

Author: Alright#0419
Content: could happen with no malicious intent

Author: Alright#0419
Content: again unlikely

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, but it needs to be combined with a precisely timed 51% attack

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and then to convince the community to allow the double spend as the split chain will need to be resolved by the community

Author: Alright#0419
Content: get an exchange on each chain, sell same coins on both

Author: Alright#0419
Content: no 51% attack involved at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the important thing to observe is that even though it is theoretically possible, it would be much easier to 51% attack a chain without dPoW

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why add notarization to make things harder to attack

Author: Alright#0419
Content: in the event of a chain split, it'd be fairly hard to send the same coins to different addresses on each fork

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it doesnt really increase the risk exposure to 51% attacks, in fact it seems to reduce the potential 51% attackers to the notaries

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not really related to what I was just saying, but I was trying to think of how you would even do that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in a chain split, it splits really cleanly into two independent chains

Author: Alright#0419
Content: we've seen chainsplits that share mempool

Author: Alright#0419
Content: never understood how that happened

Author: Alright#0419
Content: DEX split in ~Feb

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so using the chain split notarization for 51% attack, reduces the possible attackers to notaries, from everyone. seems an improvement

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: mempool can have tx that havent been spend on either chain

Content: I'm a PoS convert üòâ  ... love the electricity savings, security and speed.

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: but I've got another question: how were KMD's zeroproof keys managed? ZEC makes a big deal about destroying them.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we use zcash parameters

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: How does CMC know that there are 110,928,878 KMD in circulation? ZEC used to have that input blank and is now showing: 5,419,031 ZEC in circulation.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think they get it from the dexstats.info api

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which uses the coinsupply rpc call

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: is KMD based on 'zed'-cash params 2.0.0 (sapling)?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sapling parameters activate with the Dec 15th sapling activation

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: do KMD assetchains have their own zkSNARKs keys? or do they adopt KMD/ZEC's parameters by default?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: assetchains are runtime forks of KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: do you understand what that means?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no source code changes

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: would it be possible to give an assetchain the option of creating their own zkSNARKs keys?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not as a runtime fork

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you would need to make a source level fork and generate your own multiparty computations

Content:
Since git pull on master branch, I can't sync anymore. I've deleted komodo dir and git cloned, deleted ~/.komodo/ to sync from scratch, but it tries to "activate best chain" one block at a time, so sync'ing for hours, and ending with ```...........................Error: Out of memory. Terminating.
terminate called without an active exception
Aborted```

Content: Error: Out of memory

Content: create some virtual memory

Content: I never had this problem before on this vps, although I sync'ed from scratch many times

Content: how much RAM does your node have?

Content: not a lot, but always been enough for komodod

Content:
```              total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available
Mem:        3952576      272208     3086308       38456      594060     3417348
Swap:             0           0           0```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no swap

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: make some swap space, like $GB

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 4GB

Author: zatJUM#9924

Content: Because of sapling?

Content: 4GB is the minimum

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: create some swap space to avoid this

Author: Seko#7408
Content:
Hello @jl777c 

we in the German Telegram Channel are a little annoyed about Dr. Julian Hosp. You know him? Co-founder Ten-X and THE face in Germany, when it comes to crypto.

We know that a few months ago he was informed about Atomic Swaps via Twitter. He was in direct contact with some developers of Komodo.

He now claims that the Comit network, in which TenX is involved, makes Comit the world elite in atomic swaps. In detail, he speaks of an ERC20 swap about Lightning. No one would have done that before and Comit would be the world's elite. 

Can you say anything about that? Has Komodo ever done ERC20 on Lightning?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we havent done ERC20 on lightning. years ago i did what I call subatomic swaps, which were incrementally transferring value 1/777th at a time. It was really no big deal, so I didnt make any press release out of it. I didnt like the performance aspect as it required 777*2 small offchain transactions to complete and anything goes wrong during the process and things are left in an inbetween state. with a normal atomic swap, it either happens or unwinds so that it is as if it didnt happen. so any claim of atomicity when using lightning would need to have caveats, like it isnt actually atomic if the channel fails, or is closed, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this julian hosp? https://www.ccn.com/80-million-ico-tenx-founder-linked-to-pyramid-scheme-report/

Author: Seko#7408
Content:
That's the one. In German-speaking countries, he is slowly being unmasked by those who looked up to him in the beginning and fell into it.
People, who deal more intensively with crypto currencies, see meanwhile the shadow side. But he does it well, is on German TV. Sells well, he used to be a doctor, professional surfer, sunny boy and TenX founder. Slowly the facade of the "Saubermann" (I translate it with "serious business men") is crumbling.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Thank you...
